page.title: 15THE MEANING OF CANNICH
page.content:
The area around Cannich is rich in {local history}and the following list gives the meanings of some of the local{place names.
STRATHGLASS : Dark strath or valley of streams CANNICH : Place of wild white cotton plants KERROW : The fourth part of a davoch of land (in this case Comar) COMAR : Confluence of two rivers CROCHAIL : Narrow field BALMORE : Big{town}(there was a township here before the {evictions}in 1801). RUNAVRAID : Broad meadow INVERCANNICH: At the mouth of the River Cannich
